description: Latin levō (“I elevate, I lift up”), from levis (“light”).

verbs.description: levitate (third-person singular simple present levitates, present participle levitating, simple past and past participle levitated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to rise in the air and float, as if in defiance of gravity.
(intransitive) To be suspended in the air, as if in defiance of gravity.
examples: The guru claimed that he could levitate.
